Shareholders elect and remove with or without cause
A court will not second guess a business decision if it was 1) made in good faith, 2) director was reasonably informed and 3) had rational basis.

A fundamental corporate change such as an amendment, a merger or a conversion requires 1) board action adopting a resolution of fundamental change, 2) a board submitted proposal to shareholders with written notice, 3) a majority of shareholder approval and 4) a delivery of a document to the secretary of state
